body_html:
@Enet4 thank you for replying!

The exception I am seeing is:

java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: org.tensorflow.SavedModelBundle.load(Ljava/lang/String;[Ljava/lang/String;[B)Lorg/tensorflow/SavedModelBundle;
	at org.tensorflow.SavedModelBundle.load(Native Method)
	at org.tensorflow.SavedModelBundle.load(SavedModelBundle.java:37)

I was originally seeing this because I didn't link to the native library:

TensorFlow Java API methods will throw an UnsatisfiedLinkError unless native code shared libraries are loaded

but now I am running with the JNI I believe:


But there is one more thing you need to fix, though. You should use the saved_model API for the saved model functionality, not tf.train.Saver

Ah! That would explain it. Is the saved_model API newer or preferred to tf.train.Saver?

body:
@Enet4 thank you for replying!

The exception I am seeing is:
```
java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: org.tensorflow.SavedModelBundle.load(Ljava/lang/String;[Ljava/lang/String;[B)Lorg/tensorflow/SavedModelBundle;
	at org.tensorflow.SavedModelBundle.load(Native Method)
	at org.tensorflow.SavedModelBundle.load(SavedModelBundle.java:37)
```

I was originally seeing this because I didn't link to the native library:
```
TensorFlow Java API methods will throw an UnsatisfiedLinkError unless native code shared libraries are loaded
```

but now I am running with the JNI I believe:

![VM Options](https://puu.sh/uCGut/c04c641b11.png)
![Project Structure](https://puu.sh/uCGwE/ba35337d9c.png)

> But there is one more thing you need to fix, though. You should use the saved_model API for the saved model functionality, not tf.train.Saver

Ah! That would explain it. Is the `saved_model` API newer or preferred to `tf.train.Saver`?
